DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Suppressive Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related  to a chronic an infection caused by the hepatitis B virus and on suppressive therapy as outlined in protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Hepatitis B Infection Suppressive Antiviral Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._A viral infection caused by the hepatitis B virus._Ongoing antiviral therapy to reduce the frequency of recurrence or prevent transmission._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If there is evidence of chron
ReferenceDocuments.description: If there is evidence of chronic Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, patient should be on suppressive therapy (if indicated)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of chronic Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection, is patient on suppressive therapy?
